const Menu* const Shell::GetCurrentMenu ( const int  I_MenuIndex ) const

Current menu retrieval.

Returns:
Reference of the current menu. NULL when I_MenuIndex is out of bounds.
Parameters:
I_MenuIndexIndex of the menu in the stack. 0: root menu (bottom of the stack). 1: menu stacked over the root menu. 2: menu stacked over again... -1: current menu (top of the stack)

Warning:

void Shell::QuitThreadSafe ( void   )

Terminates the shell.

Warning:
The shell will actually quit as soon as the input device return a character.

Prompt message positionning.

Parameters:
CLI_PromptPrompt string. When an empty string is given, the default prompt (depending on the current menu) is restored.
const bool Shell::SetStream ( const STREAM_TYPE  E_StreamType,
OutputDevice &  CLI_Stream 
)

Output stream positionning.

Warning:
Please ensure one of the following conditions regarding the given device:
  • Either the device is an auto-deleted device,
  • or it will be destroyed after this shell object,
  • or another call to this method with the null device is done on termination. Otherwise you could experience consistency troubles. The null device and standard devices are not subject to this remark.
Parameters:
E_StreamTypeOutput stream identifier.
CLI_StreamStream reference.
void Shell::SetWelcomeMessage ( const ResourceString &  CLI_WelcomeMessage )

Parameters:
CLI_WelcomeMessageWelcome message. When an empty string is given, the default welcome message is restored.
